senses.sense_definition: The part of a military force that protects the rear, especially during a retreat.

examples.text: The general ordered the <w>rearguard</w> to hold the bridge while the rest of the army escaped.
Soldiers in the <w>rearguard</w> faced the advancing enemy to buy time for their comrades.

senses.sense_definition: A determined defensive effort or a group of defenders, often used in sports or politics to describe resistance against an attack or change.

examples.text: The team fought a desperate <w>rearguard</w> action to keep the score level until the final whistle.
Opponents of the new law launched a political <w>rearguard</w> to prevent it from passing.
